" What was your life like when you were growing up?" Carnage asked.

Teltoli frowned, and rubbed her forehead briefly before folding her 
arms again. Her eyes flickered towards Carnage, and she tilted her 
head to one side, wondering why she would ask such a thing. 
Nevertheless, she answered anyway.

"I guess up until I joined the Army and was sent on different 
missions, I was being pulled in two different directions. One was my 
Mother, who wanted me to become a noble person at heart, and teach me 
peace and never to harm another person, even if they were attacking 
you"

The Fuzor shook her head in disbelief of her Mother. "She said that a 
violent life is stained, even if it is long. She said.. well she said 
a lot of things. About peace, and how if you harmed another, even 
your attacker, you were dulled somehow. Like if a tree chops wood, it 
commits 'violence', but the edge of the ax gets dulled" She shrugged.

"And my Father said that I should become a fighter, to serve 
Cybertron with my last breath. As a kid, I didn't really wanna die 
for anything" Teltoli snorted, sounding a bit like a chuckle. "And 
they both started to train me, I guess. One day I was being taught 
proper manners, the other I had to forget all those manners and fight 
with a sword I could hardly pick up"

She walked in silence for a few seconds, sighing quietly. "And then, 
when I turned into a teenager, I was to be engaged to this guy that I 
didn't even know. He was a proper Noble, but way too posh for my 
liking. He was all like 'Oh Teltoli, we were meant to be together!' 
and all of this. Very uncomfortable.." Teltoli rolled her eyes.

"But once I joined the Army, that got rid of him *and* the manners my 
Mother taught me.. and here I am" She finished the last bit by 
spreading her arms wide, and smiling slightly.

"How did you end up on this planet anyway.. I don't think you ever 
told me?"

The Fuzor plucked a long leaf and its stalk from a plant, and began 
knocking other leaves aside with it. 'Just like a kid..' Her mind 
mocked and she scowled, suddenly throwing the leaf away.
